00016 CTextViewer::CTextViewer(SDL_Surface *TextVSfc, int x, int y, int w, int h) :
00017 m_timer(0)
00018 {
00019  m_x = x; m_y = y;
00020  m_w = w; m_h = h;
00021  
00022  m_scrollpos = m_linepos = 0;
00023  m_8x8tilewidth = m_8x8tileheight = 8;
00024  m_TextVSfc = TextVSfc;
00025  m_mustclose = false;
00026 }
00027 
00028 void CTextViewer::scrollDown()
00029 {
00030  if( m_scrollpos < m_8x8tileheight )
00031  {
00032   m_scrollpos+=4;
00033  }
00034  else
00035  {
00036   if( m_linepos < (int)m_textline.size() - (m_h/m_8x8tileheight) )
00037   {
00038    m_scrollpos = 0;
00039    setNextPos();
00040   }
00041  }
00042 }
00043 
00044 void CTextViewer::scrollUp()
00045 {
00046  if( m_scrollpos > 0 )
00047  {
00048   m_scrollpos-=4;
00049  }
00050  else
00051  {
00052   if( m_linepos > 0 )
00053   {
00054    m_scrollpos = m_8x8tileheight;
00055    setPrevPos();
00056   }
00057  }
00058 }
00059 
00060 void CTextViewer::setNextPos()
00061 { setPosition(m_linepos+1); }
00062 
00063 void CTextViewer::setPrevPos()
00064 { setPosition(m_linepos-1); }
00065 
00066 void CTextViewer::setPosition(int pos)
00067 { if( pos>=0 && pos < (int) m_textline.size() - (m_h/m_8x8tileheight-1) )
00068  m_linepos = pos; }

00070 void CTextViewer::loadText(const std::string &text)
00071 {
00072  mp_text = text;
00073  
00074  // Trim strings the way they fit into the textbox
00075  // TODO: Use more C++ specific stuff and less code to perform that trimming operations
00076  std::string buf;
00077  int totlen=0;
00078  for(unsigned long i=0 ; i<mp_text.size() ; i++ )
00079  {
00080   buf.push_back(mp_text[i]);
00081   
00082   if( mp_text[i] == '\n' )
00083   {
00084    m_textline.push_back(buf);
00085    buf.clear();
00086    continue;
00087   }
00088 
00089   if(i+3 < mp_text.size())
00090   {
00091    if(mp_text[i+1] == 26)
00092    {
00093     mp_text[i+1] = '\n';
00094     mp_text[i+2] = ' ';
00095     mp_text[i+3] = ' ';
00096    }
00097   }
00098   
00099   if(i+1 < mp_text.size())
00100    totlen=buf.size() + getnextwordlength(mp_text.c_str()+i+1);
00101   else
00102    totlen=buf.size() + getnextwordlength(mp_text.c_str()+i);
00103 
00104   if( totlen > (m_w/m_8x8tilewidth-2) && mp_text[i] != '_' ) // Or does the next fit into the line?
00105   {
00106    m_textline.push_back(buf);
00107    buf = "";
00108   }
00109  }
00110  
00111  // Afterworks: First, the last line has a delimiter of 26. That really sucks! The rest after that must be trimmed
00112  //      Second, we add two empty lines for a nice style when the text is scrolled.
00113  // Append an empty line for a nice style, when scrolling
00114  if(buf.size()>=1)
00115   buf.erase(buf.size()-1);
00116  m_textline.push_back(buf);
00117  m_textline.push_back("");
00118  
00119  // Change the colours to read and grey background, when '~' is detected at the beginning
00120  // Also remove the escape sequences
00121  std::vector<std::string>::iterator it;
00122  for( it = m_textline.begin() ; it != m_textline.end()  ; it++  )
00123  {
00124   for(unsigned int j=0 ; j < it->size() ; j++ )
00125   {
00126    if( (*it)[j] == 31 ||
00127       (*it)[j] == 13 ||
00128       (*it)[j] == 10 )  (*it)[j] = ' ';
00129   }
00130   
00131   if( (*it)[0] == '~' )
00132   {
00133    for(unsigned int j=1 ; j < it->size() ; j++ )
00134    {
00135     (*it)[j] += 128;        // Magic number that makes the text red with grey background
00136     (*it)[j-1] = (*it)[j];  // Move all the character one unit to the left
00137    }
00138    
00139    while( it->size() < (unsigned int)(m_w/m_8x8tilewidth) ) // if the text is smaller than the width of the textbox, fill it with grey background
00140     it->push_back(' ' + 128);
00141   }
00142  }
00143 }
00144 
00145 unsigned char CTextViewer::getnextwordlength(const std::string nextword)
00146 {
00147  int i=0;
00148  while(nextword[i] != ' ' && nextword[i] != '\n' && nextword[i] != 26 ) i++;
00149  return i;
00150 }
00151 
00152 void CTextViewer::drawTextlines()
00153 {
00154  for(int i=1 ; i<(m_h/m_8x8tileheight) && i<(int)m_textline.size()-m_linepos ; i++)
00155   g_pGfxEngine->getFont(0).drawFont(m_TextVSfc,
00156           m_textline[i+m_linepos-1],
00157           m_x+m_8x8tilewidth,
00158           m_y + (i)*m_8x8tileheight-m_scrollpos,
00159           false);
00160 }
00161 
00162 // Most common render function for this TextViewer
00163 void CTextViewer::process()
00164 {
00165   // Normal Keys/Axes
00166   if( g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_DOWN) )
00167   {
00168    m_timer++;
00169    if(m_timer >= 2)
00170     scrollDown();
00171   }
00172   if( g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_UP) )
00173   {
00174    m_timer++;
00175    if(m_timer >= 2)
00176     scrollUp();
00177   }
00178   
00179   // Page Keys
00180   if( g_pInput->getPressedKey(KPGDN) )
00181    setPosition(m_linepos+16);
00182   if( g_pInput->getPressedKey(KPGUP) )
00183    setPosition(m_linepos-16);
00184   
00185   if(m_timer>=8) m_timer=0;
00186   
00187   if(g_pInput->getPressedKey(KQUIT) || g_pInput->getPressedKey(KQ) )
00188    m_mustclose = true;
00189   
00190   renderBox(); // This comes after, because it does transparent overlay
00191 }
00192 
00193 // This function shows the Story of Commander Keen!
00194 void CTextViewer::renderBox()
00195 {
00196  // first draw the blank rect
00197  CFont &Font = g_pGfxEngine->getFont(0);
00198  int i, j;
00199  for(j = 0 ; j < m_h - m_8x8tileheight ; j+= m_8x8tileheight )
00200  {
00201   for(i = 0 ; i < m_w - m_8x8tilewidth ; i+= m_8x8tilewidth )
00202    Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 32, m_x + i, m_y + j); // 32 is a blank tile
00203   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 32, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + j);
00204  }
00205  
00206  if(!m_textline.empty())
00207   drawTextlines();
00208  
00209  // then the borders
00210  for( i = m_8x8tilewidth ; i < m_w-m_8x8tilewidth ; i+= m_8x8tilewidth )
00211  {
00212   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 2, m_x + i, m_y); // 2 is one upper-border
00213   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 7, m_x + i, m_y + m_h - m_8x8tileheight );  // 7 is also the lower-border
00214  }
00215  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 2, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y ); // for the last tile
00216  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 2, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + m_h - m_8x8tileheight ); // for the last tile
00217  
00218  for( j = m_8x8tileheight ; j < m_h-m_8x8tileheight ; j+= m_8x8tileheight )
00219  {
00220   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 4, m_x, m_y + j);   // 4 is one left-border
00221   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 5, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + j); // 5 is the right-border
00222  }
00223  
00224  // At last the corners
00225  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 1, m_x, m_y ); // Upper-Left corner
00226  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 3, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y ); // Upper-Right corner
00227  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 6, m_x, m_y + m_h - m_8x8tileheight ); // Lower-Left corner
00228  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 8, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + m_h - m_8x8tileheight ); // Lower-Right corner
00229  
00230  // It has Scroll Controls, so the user knows, that he can scroll down, up and quit
00231  // fill the area with grey tiles
00232  for( i=m_8x8tilewidth ; i<m_w-m_8x8tilewidth ; i+=m_8x8tilewidth )
00233   for( j=0 ; j<2*m_8x8tileheight ; j+=m_8x8tileheight )
00234    Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 160, m_x+i, m_y+m_h+j ); // just grey small tile
00235  
00236  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 4, m_x, m_y + m_h );       // 4 is one left-border
00237  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 5, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + m_h );  // 5 is the right-border
00238  for( i = m_8x8tilewidth ; i < m_w-m_8x8tilewidth ; i+= m_8x8tilewidth )
00239   Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 7, m_x + i, m_y + m_h + m_8x8tileheight );      // 7 is also the lower-border
00240  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 6, m_x, m_y + m_h + m_8x8tileheight );       // Lower-Left corner
00241  Font.drawCharacter(m_TextVSfc, 8, m_x + m_w - m_8x8tilewidth, m_y + m_h + m_8x8tileheight );  // Lower-Right corner
00242  
00243  // Now print the helping text
00244  Font.drawFont(m_TextVSfc, "ESC to Exit / \17 \23 to Read",
00245          m_x+m_8x8tilewidth+(m_w/2)-12*m_8x8tilewidth, m_y+m_h, true);
00246 }
